snippet: Prosecutors said 215 nongovernmental groups had violated the contentious new law, potentially setting the stage for new legal confrontations.
abstract: Russian prosecutors say that 215 nongovernmental organizations have violated contentious new Russian law that requires them to register as 'foreign agents' if they receive financing from overseas; many groups have defied law, saying it is redolent of cold war espionage.
lead_paragraph: Prosecutors said 215 nongovernmental groups had violated the contentious new law, potentially setting the stage for new legal confrontations.

headline.main: Russia Says Nonprofits Violate ‘Foreign Agent’ Law
headline.print_headline: Russia: Nonprofits Defy a New Law
